meanings.definition: A stick or rod approximately one yard long, used for measuring.
meanings.sent1: I used a yardstick to measure the length of the table.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter always carries a yardstick in his toolbox.
meanings.sent3: The yardstick decided to go on strike because it was tired of measuring things.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, the yardstick was a magic wand that could make everything perfect.
meanings.sent5: The bright yellow yardstick stood out among the other tools in the shed.

meanings.definition: A standard or criterion for comparison.
meanings.sent1: The company uses customer satisfaction as a yardstick for success.
meanings.sent2: In education, test scores are often used as yardsticks to measure student performance.
meanings.sent3: The yardstick at the race track was upset because it couldn't participate in the competition.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was the yardstick by which all other acts of generosity were measured.
meanings.sent5: The old oak tree served as a natural yardstick for the growth of the town over the years.
